citances.sentence: Mr Williams rejects the proposition that the Contract may be terminated at any time for any reason, saying that it "cannot seriously be suggested that the parties expected that the employment would be terminated for no reason at all (even if that were legally permissible)". Mr Williams further submits that the fact that the Contract designated a method of termination and specified a period of notice (albeit a short one) supports the proposition that the employment is not casual in nature. Casual employees, Mr Williams contends, are traditionally employed day to day whereas the period of engagement of a full-time or part-time employee is week to week as reflected in a formal period of notice for termination. Mr Williams cites Thompson v Big Bert Ltd t/as Charles Hotel [2007] FCA 1978 ; (2007) 168 IR 309 at [58] in support of this proposition.
